data.title: Mount Saint Joseph Academy
data.text:
The academic excellence that the Mount is known for extends throughout the school in all we do. Young women at the Mount are consistently engaged in co-curricular programming—clubs, student activities and societies span the full range of student interest and inspire new passions from service organizations and performance groups to academic interest clubs such as Robotics, honor societies, and much more. The Mount Fine Arts program teaches technique and skill while allowing each students to discover their own uniquely creative voice and our acclaimed Mount Athletics program offers 13 sports that instill qualities of leadership, confidence, sisterhood and strength.

Following the Sisters of Saint Joseph tradition, students are unifiers who support their peers in all their endeavors. The Mount is a strong and resilient community built with active inclusive love. Daily Advisory time with adult and student leaders provides a space where there is an intentional focus on Academics, Mission, Community and Clubs. Students attend mission-focused and faith-centered retreats throughout their years at the Mount and engage in intentional and engaging Campus Ministry program that embraces all and leads our young women to Serve the Dear Neighbor.

At the Mount, our dedicated faculty use their expertise and experience in their disciplines to create lasting and limitless learning in the classroom and beyond. Our college-style block schedule with 80 minute classes, provides collaborative, impactful, engaging and flexible teaching and learning for our students and educators. Curricular features such as our Women as Founders Seminar, a mission-aligned course where students select a research project centered around a social issue of personal significance, and an integrated math and science curriculum where teachers collaborate to effectively teach the subjects with an interdisciplinary approach allow for specialized and personalized schedules. We also offer unique courses such as Principles of Engineering and Design, Print and Broadcast Journalism courses and are one of a few schools nationwide that offer both AP Computer Science A and AP Computer Science.

Students at the Mount flourish in a learning community that challenges and inspires young women to dream big and journey deep, to lead with compassion and to seek God in themselves and others. Our Learning Team serves a range of learners with research-based, inclusive methods to help with time management and build lifelong strategies and skills. Our College Counseling Program helps students in grades 10-12 explore their passions and goals in order to find a right-fit institution of higher learning and our School Counselors partner with students one-on-one from the first to their last days of their Mount experience to focus on holistic health and wellness.Young women at the Mount develop skills around self-awareness, self-management, social awareness, relationship building and responsible decision-making.

2023 Alumnae Hall of Fame Recipient

"I left the Mount as a self-aware, confident young woman: ready for college. I returned many years later with a heart to serve. I hope that the work I am doing on the Mount's Board and in my profession proves valuable in the long term and that seeds I have sown will continue to sow, reap a bountiful harvest."

Track & Field/ Cross Country Student-Athlete, Class of 2024

2x 800 Meter State Runner Up, 3x AACA XC Champ, District 1 Champion XC 2022, and District 1 Champion 1600 Meters 2022

“The culture and environment provided by the Mount has given me the opportunity to grow my confidence as a young woman and value the principles of support and collaboration from my classmates and teammates. The mission of the Mount community has developed in me a sense of leadership that will prepare me for any future challenges and the eagerness to constantly strive for more while in the classroom and on the track.”
